title: Who will start for the Browns and Colts in Week 1? We made QB battle predictions
content: We talked to sources to help project open QB1 races in Cleveland, Indianapolis, New Orleans and New York.

title: Deion says he's cancer-free after bladder removal
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Guardians' Clase on leave over gambling probe
content: Cleveland Guardians closer Emmanuel Clase was placed on non-disciplinary paid leave through Aug. 31 as part of Major League Baseball's investigation into sports gambling, the second Guardians pitcher to be caught up in the inquiry.

title: Man pleads guilty, sent to prison for stalking Clark
content: A 55-year-old Texas man has been sentenced to more than 18 months in prison after pleading guilty Monday to stalking and harassing WNBA star Caitlin Clark.

title: Trimmed-down Doncic: My 'body looks better'
content: Luka Doncic said he took a "huge step" in improving his conditioning this summer, adding that his "whole body looks better."

title: Employee suing Suns for retaliation fired by team
content: The Phoenix Suns have fired an employee who is suing the team for discrimination, harassment and retaliation, ESPN has learned.

title: 👀 Messi and wife caught on Coldplay 'kiss cam'
content: Lionel Messi attended the Coldplay concert on Sunday night at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami with his family.

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: Updated ranking of MLB's top 50 trade deadline candidates: New names added
content: Our running list of who could be traded has some big changes in the final few days before the July 31 deadline.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Why Mets could trade Vientos
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: Can Ashton Jeanty deliver on the hype? Those who've watched his career have no doubt
content: Ashton Jeanty started turning heads as a 14-year-old in Naples, Italy. His coaches, teammates and even his opponents have been witnesses to his rise.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the WNBA trade deadline.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: 'Everybody just died laughing': Teammates, opponents on what makes Ichiro a Hall of Fame icon
content: As a Mariners icon gets his Cooperstown call, teammates and opponents share what makes him 100% Hall of Fame worthy.

title: Pérez: What it was like to play with three 2025 HOFers
content: Eduardo Pérez believes this year's inductees are more than great players -- their hearts and characters stand out.

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Refreshed as Manchester United begin their U.S. preseason tour, Ruben Amorim finally has the time to implement the changes he feels will turn the club around.

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: Late heroics, Reggie the dog and a new team mantra. Here's the inside story of how England won the 2025 European Championship.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: UFC Abu Dhabi takeaways: Why Whittaker's loss is good for the middleweight division
content: What does Reinier de Ridder's win mean for the middleweight division? Brett Okamoto provides takeaways.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Woad, 21, wins Scottish Open in debut as pro
content: Two weeks ago, Lottie Woad was the world's No. 1 amateur. On Sunday, the 21-year-old Englishwoman became an LPGA Tour champion in her professional debut.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: Beed sarpanch murder case: Court rejects Walmik Karad’s discharge plea
content: The prosecution in the court argued that accused Walmik Karad conspired with co-accused persons, demanding a ransom of ₹2 crores from the officials of the company Avaada Energy Private Ltd

title: NSCN faction says Assam eviction drive planned to grab Naga ancestral lands
content: The outfit says the areas targeted were fictitiously marked ‘disturbed area belt’, citing demarcations by the British, who transferred these areas for administrative convenience

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) delegation meets Governor, demands removal of ‘corrupt’ Ministers
content: The delegation submitted a memorandum to the governor, underlining several incidents of misconduct by Ministers in the State Cabinet and provided evidence

title: Ceasefire had no linkage with U.S. trade: Jaishankar in Parliament
content: There was no call between the Prime Minister and President Trump from April 22 – when President Trump called up to convey his sympathy – and June 17, says Jaishankar

title: DMK has failed in its duty and surrendered to the BJP: Vijay
content: He says the Centre has sidelined Tamil Nadu, but now Prime Minister Narendra Modi is announcing statues for Chola kings and “taking lessons” from the Chola dynasty

title: Mamata asks migrants harassed in other States to return to West Bengal
content: Earlier in the day, during an administrative meeting West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee proposed to include migrant workers who returned to the state after 100 days of work under MGNREGA

title: Set for a record: paddy procurement in Tamil Nadu likely to touch 45-lakh-tonne mark soon
content: As of now, 44.49 lakh tonnes have been procured. With the State procuring an average of about 15,000 tonnes from farmers on a daily basis, the current high of 44.95 lakh tonnes, collected in 2020-21, will be crossed in a few days

title: Yemen revokes Nimisha Priya’s death sentence, claims Kanthapuram
content: Yemeni Islamic scholars, Northern Yemen government officials and international diplomats join forces to secure reprieve for Indian nurse on death row

title: Bus fare subsidy helps women save 30-50% on transport costs, increase edu spending: Study
content: The report revealed that in cities such as Nagpur and Pune, where fare subsidies apply primarily to intercity or long-distance routes, average monthly savings range from ₹409 to ₹538

title: Farmers in Punjab stage demonstration under KMM banner against Govt’s land pooling policy; Akali Dal also protests
content: Shiromani Akali Dal members staged a protest rally in Mohali against the land pooling policy. The party announced to hold another demonstration rally in Bathinda on August 4

title: Nuns are innocent, say family members of tribal women
content: Arrest of Keralite nuns in Chhattisgarh trigger protests; siblings of the purported victims reject allegations of trafficking and forcible conversion; they say the tribal women were accompanying the nuns to Agra for a job with the consent of family members; Chhattisgarh Chief Minister defends arrest

title: CS instructs officials not to appoint teachers to revise voters’ list
content: Shalini Rajneesh has instructed officials to appoint non-teaching staff, officers, and staff members working in various departments on priority basis for the task of revising the voters’ list

title: India, Japan officials meet, discuss PM’s visit, bullet train project
content: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is expected to visit India for the Quad Summit, along with U.S. President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, later this year

title: State sees a fall in seroprevalence of Hepatitis B, says nodal officer
content: World Hepatitis Day is observed on July 28 to raise awareness on the liver infection caused by five types of viruses A, B, C, D and E; sex workers, drug users and those who get tattoos are generally considered to be at higher risk

title: Centre should abandon security-centric approach, engage in dialogue to resolve J&K issues: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Speaking at the PDP’s 26th foundation day event, she says Centre should restore trust of the people by engaging in a process that respects their dignity and rights

title: Google officials depose before ED in online betting linked PMLA case
content: The agency may also record the statement of a designated "compliance officer" of Google under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) apart from obtaining some documents from the company

title: Nuns to stay, serve in Gaza despite attacks, says Missionaries of Charity
content: The Missionaries of Charity has served in multiple conflict zones in the world, including in Gaza; the organisation said that the nuns “have been there from the beginning of the conflict”

title: Only by acknowledging diversity can India progress, says D. Raja
content: Releasing the book Kaalamthorum Communists, he urges communists to work closely with Periyarists and Ambedkarists to liberate people from exploitation and inequality

title: LJP(RV) will continue in the NDA, says senior party leader and MP Arun Bharti
content: Mr. Bharti’s remarks come in the backdrop of party President Chirag Paswan’s critical comments against the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar

title: Congress sources say Shashi Tharoor opted out of debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha
content: BJP member Baijant Panda claims Mr. Tharoor was not allowed to speak by his party as he spoke in “national interest”

title: Mamata Banerjee ‘reminds’ officials they work for the State not ECI
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister directed officials to ensure that not a single name is removed from the voters list and that people should not be harassed

title: Kamra, Andhare deny charges in reply to breach of privilege notice
content: While Shiv Sena UBT leader Sushma Andhare asked how is ‘gaddar’ (traitor) an unparliamentary word, Kunal Kamra said the term has been used while targeting politicians during ‘heated’ exchanges

title: Why did Justice Varma submit to in-house inquiry if it was contrary to Constitution, Supreme Court asks
content: The query came after senior advocate Kapil Sibal complained that the action taken by the Supreme Court at the time, including release of sensitive visual and audio materials showing ‘burnt currency’, “convicted” Justice Varma in the public eye

title: Private defence suppliers seek review of rules limiting ammunition procurement to public sector
content: A private defence manufacturer says if the MoD amends the existing rule to allow for open Request For Proposal to be issued to both public and private sector, it will provide a big boost to the private ammunition industry

title: Procedure to redress chemically contaminated sites gets legal teeth
content: The new rules are part of a process of “legally codifying” the process in place once contaminated sites were identified; under these rules, the district administration would prepare half-yearly reports on “suspected contaminated sites”

title: BRS, Sigachi victims’ kin flay delay in handing over bodies, ex-gratia
content: Harish Rao asks why details of total deaths, injured persons not announced even after a month of the mishap

title: Congress raises questions on security lapses which led to Pahalgam attack
content: Congress leader Gaurav Gogoi asks govt. to clarify claims made by U.S. President Trump that he used trade to bring about truce between India and Pakistan; Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee says no country supported India during the conflict

title:
Will Modi speak in North India about 
Rajendra Chola’s victorious expedition, asks  TNCC chief Selvaperunthagai
content: The TNCC president dares Mr. Modi to speak about installing a statue for Rajendra Chola in North India and the defeat he had meted out to the north Indian armies during his expedition

title: BJP MPs protest against Muslim cleric’s remarks on Samajwadi Party leader Dimple Yadav
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi, the cleric, had criticised Ms. Yadav, wife of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav, for visiting a mosque near the Parliament without covering her head

title: Three months after SC order, West Bengal government yet to pay DA dues of employees
content: DA arrears, unemployment and lack of jobs trigger fresh unrest in State; heavy police deployment fails to deter marchers

title: NIA submits reports on Jiribam killings, Manipur HC gives one month to file chargesheet
content: Last month, the court had said that it had been a considerable time since the incident and yet no chargesheet had been filed in the case in which six persons were abducted and later found dead

title: Gujarat tops July rankings in Centre’s PM-JANMAN tribal mission
content: The western State is home to five Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Groups — Kathodi, Kotwalia, Padhar, Siddi, and Kolgha; the government is focused on addressing development gaps through targeted delivery, said officials

title: Six-year-old killed, two injured in school gate collapse in Jaisalmer
content: The concrete structure of the main gate had weakened after a vehicle hit it sometime ago; it collapsed under the impact of strong winds

title: ASHAs urge Kerala govt. to keep its promise by increasing honorarium
content: The strike by a section of ASHA workers in the State, demanding a hike in honorarium as well as a better pay package, has crossed 170 days.

title: Notices to 3.75 lakh property tax defaulters
content: As of January, 2025, 2.06 lakh property owners were still defaulters and their arrears added to ₹329.15 Crore

title: M.R. Ajith Kumar appointed Excise Commissioner
content: The decision comes in the wake of a controversy over Ajith Kumar using a tractor to travel in Sabarimala, an act disapproved by the Kerala High Court

title: Three drown in water-logged fields
content: While the dead bodies of two individuals were found on Sunday, a third dead body was recovered in the afternoon on Monday

title: Judge blocks Trump administration's efforts to defund Planned Parenthood
content: A federal judge ruled Planned Parenthood clinics nationwide must continue to be reimbursed for Medicaid funding as the nation's largest abortion provider fights  Trump's administration over efforts to defund the organization in his tax legislation

title: Trump Says Gaza Ceasefire 'Possible' Amid Starmer Talks
content: Donald Trump said a ceasefire in Gaza was "possible", and stepped up warnings to Russia, as he met UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer at one of the US president's Scottish golf resorts on Monday.

title: 4 Girl Students In Hospital. They Were Made To Do 200 Sit-Ups For Being Late
content: Four students were admitted to a hospital in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum on Monday as they collapsed after allegedly being made to do 200 sit-ups for reaching school late, according to their families.

title: "Appeal In Disguise": Tamil Nadu To Top Court On Presidential Reference On Governor's Powers
content: The Tamil Nadu government has urged the Supreme Court to declare the Presidential Reference on the powers and timelines for Governors and the President to act on state bills as "not maintainable".

title: US Plan To Destroy Women's Contraception Products Worth Millions Sparks Uproar
content: The US administration's decision to destroy nearly $10 million worth of women's contraception products has sparked furious condemnation from doctors and aid groups, who have slammed the move as a wasteful attack on women's rights.

title: US Plan To Destroy Women's Contraception Products Worth Millions Sparks Uproar
content: The US administration's decision to destroy nearly $10 million worth of women's contraception products has sparked furious condemnation from doctors and aid groups, who have slammed the move as a wasteful attack on women's rights.

title: "Jhalawar School Tragedy Heart-Wrenching": Rajasthan High Court
content: The Rajasthan High Court has taken suo motu cognisance of the tragic school building collapse in Jhalawar, calling the incident "heart-wrenching."

title: Phone-Tapping Rampant Under Revanth Reddy, Alleges Opposition Leader
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi leader and former IPS officer RS Praveen Kumar has lodged a formal complaint with the police levelling serious allegations against Telangana's Congress government.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 6 Highlights: Union Home Minister Amit Shah To Address Lok Sabha Tuesday Noon
content: As the Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor intensifies, Union Home Minister Amit Shah is scheduled to address the House at 12 noon on Tuesday.

title: Did A 17-Year-Old From Bihar Build A Plane For Rs 7,000? A Fact Check
content: A video claiming that a teenager from Bihar built a working aircraft using scrap in seven days is going viral on social media.

title: 3 Reasons Why Bihar Roll Revision Can't Be Discussed In Parliament: Sources
content: There will be no discussion on Bihar voter list revision in Parliament despite the Opposition's demand, the government has indicated, underscoring a reason cited by former Speaker Balaram Jakhar, sources have said.

title: Trump Eyes 'World Tariff' Of 15-20% For Most Countries
content: President Donald Trump said on Monday most trading partners that do not negotiate separate trade deals would soon face tariffs of 15% to 20% on their exports to the United States, well above the broad 10% tariff he imposed in April.

title: China To Offer Childcare Subsidies To Boost Birth Rate Amid Demographic Crisis
content: China's government will offer subsidies to parents to the tune of $500 per child under the age of three per year, Beijing's state media said Monday, as the world's second most populous nation faces a looming demographic crisis.

title: Gaza Civil Defence Said Israeli Fire Killed 16 Palestinians
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said 16 people were killed by Israeli fire Monday in the Palestinian territory devastated by more than 21 months of war.

title: Conversion Case: Probe Agency ED Gets Chhangur Baba's Custody Till August 1
content: A special PMLA court in Lucknow on Monday granted a five-day custody of Chhangur Baba to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) as part of a money-laundering investigation against him and his associates.

title: Video: Thar Collides With Scooter, Driver Then Reverses SUV To Hit Rider In Jammu
content: A speeding Mahindra Thar was trying to overtake an SUV on a single-lane road. Meanwhile, a man on a scooty, who was riding on his side of the road, was approaching the car.

title: Ex-Army Jawan Beaten To Death By Neighbour In UP's Deoria: Cops
content: A 65-year-old retired Army jawan was beaten to death following a dispute here on Monday, police said.

title: Over 10 Lakh Job Seekers In Madhya Pradesh From Other Backward Classes
content: In Madhya Pradesh, the weight of unemployment is heaviest among Other Backward Classes (OBCs), who form the largest group of job-seekers in the state.

title: Karnataka Woman Strangles Brother To Death After He Tests HIV Positive: Cops
content: A 23-year-old man was strangled to death allegedly by his sister and brother-in-law to "protect family's honour" after she discovered that he was HIV positive, police said on Monday.

title: Probe Ordered Into Key Delhi Flyover Project, Rekha Gupta Points Fingers At AAP
content: Delhi's Barapullah Elevated Road Phase-III project, long overdue and over budget, is back in the spotlight.

title: Assam CM meets PM Modi, Finance and Coal Ministers in Delhi
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Op Sindoor debate: BJP takes swipe at Cong with Tharoor mention - 'No one could stop him from ...'
content: During the Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, BJP leader Baijayant Panda criticized Congress, pointedly mentioning Shashi Tharoor. Panda suggested the discussion would be more engaging if Congress allowed its capable speakers, like Tharoor, to participate freely. He noted Tharoor's eloquence and expressed pleasure that he spoke in the national interest despite perceived restrictions from his own party leadership.

title: SIR in Bihar: Accept Aadhaar along with voter ID, SC tells EC
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar and EPIC for voter authentication during the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls. The court emphasized that the SIR should focus on broad inclusion rather than exclusion. While rejecting a stay on the SIR, the court agreed to daily hearings for a swift resolution.

title: Rajnath Singh: Operation Sindoor achieved objective, was then 'paused'
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh defended Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, stating its objective was to punish Pakistan for proxy terrorism by eliminating terror nurseries, and it was paused after achieving desired results, not due to US pressure. The opposition criticized the government for halting the operation and demanded accountability for security lapses in Pahalgam and clarification on downed Indian jets, questioning the operation's success and the delay in reclaiming PoK.

title: Ex-Google AI engineer shares his experience after joining Microsoft: ‘I’m already …’
content: Amar Subramanya, previously at Google, has joined Microsoft as Corporate VP of AI. He appreciates Microsoft's collaborative and ambitious culture. Subramanya highlights the company's focus on AI foundation models and Microsoft Copilot. Other DeepMind team members have also reportedly joined Microsoft. This hiring trend reflects the competitive AI landscape. Microsoft's leadership is committed to advancing AI technology.

title: Killing of terrorist who led Pahalgam strike blunts opposition's attack in House
content: Just before the Operation Sindoor debate, the killing of three alleged terrorists near Srinagar, including Suleiman, the suspected mastermind of the Pahalgam massacre, seemingly deflated the opposition's planned criticism of the government's counterterrorism efforts. Despite this development, SP's Ramashankar Rajbhar questioned the delay in arresting those responsible for the Pahalgam attack, even as BJP's Baijyant Panda celebrated the news of Suleiman's death during Operation Mahadev.

title: Monsoon session: At no stage of talks with US was trade tied to Sindoor, says EAM - details
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar defended India's global outreach following the Pahalgam attack, asserting overwhelming international support and dismissing claims of policy failure. He highlighted backing from Quad, Brics, and the UNSC, emphasizing India's right to defend against cross-border terrorism. Jaishankar also criticized past Congress actions and defended his China visit for de-escalation talks.

title: Apex court lifts HC stay on West Bengal OBC list
content: The Supreme Court has overturned the Calcutta High Court's stay on West Bengal's revised OBC sub-group list, which includes 80 Muslim sub-groups. The court emphasized that the Executive branch can notify such lists without needing legislation, citing a previous nine-judge bench ruling. The High Court's stay was deemed erroneous, and the case may be reassigned to a special bench for review.

title: Zuckerberg appoints ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of Meta’s AI lab
content: Mark Zuckerberg has announced Shengjia Zhao as the chief scientist of Meta Superintelligence Labs. Zhao co-created ChatGPT. He also played a key role in developing GPT-4. Meta has invested heavily in AI talent acquisition. The company has hired talents from Google, OpenAI, Apple and Anthropic. Meta will also spend billions on AI data centers in the US.

title: Pahalgam massacre: 'Homegrown' ultras may be involved, says P Chidambaram, sparks row
content: A political firestorm has erupted over P. Chidambaram's suggestion that the Pahalgam attackers might be homegrown, sparking sharp criticism from BJP leaders. They accuse Congress of echoing Pakistan's narrative and undermining the army's efforts. Chidambaram defends his statement, claiming it was taken out of context and misrepresented by trolls seeking to spread misinformation.

title: Deion Sanders & Karrueche Tran: Dating rumours swirl — what we know so far
content: Deion Sanders is facing health issues. Karrueche Tran is reportedly offering support. Dating rumors are circulating online. They were spotted dining together earlier this year. Karrueche is an Emmy-winning actress. She is known for her roles in Claws and The Bay. Deion's ex-wife reposted his message. His son posted a video from the hospital.

title: BlackRock to staff: You cannot carry your phones & laptops to China, instead ...
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: Bengal polls: EC releases 2002 SIR data; signals rolls revision
content: The Election Commission has released the 2002 special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bengal, covering 109 assembly segments across 11 districts. This move is seen as a precursor to a new SIR rollout in the state. Simultaneously, the CEO's office is addressing complaints of false voters, summoning officials for clarification. These actions coincide with ongoing training for booth level officers.

title: EC has become a BJP agent to implement NRC: Mamata Banerjee
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the Election Commission of acting as a "BJP agent" to implement NRC during a rally in Bolpur. She challenged the poll body to delete any genuine Bengal voter and cautioned booth level officers against harassing people, reminding them of their state government employment.

title: Wozniacki & Lee: 'Our family couldn't be happier'; quietly welcome baby Max
content: Caroline Wozniacki and David Lee welcomed their third child, Max Wozniacki Lee, on July 26th. The tennis star shared a heartwarming photo of her older children, Olivia and James, cradling their new baby brother. Wozniacki hinted at the pregnancy earlier this year and her tennis future remains uncertain as she focuses on her growing family.

title: Patrick Sr: Court grants travel approval to Arizona; father heads to support son in Chiefs
content: Patrick Mahomes Sr., facing probation for a felony DWI charge, has received court approval to travel from Texas to Arizona. He plans to attend the Kansas City Chiefs' preseason game against the Arizona Cardinals on August 9, 2025, in Glendale. A Smith County judge granted the request, allowing Mahomes Sr. to support his son, Patrick Mahomes, at the game.

title: Kuznetsov: Eyes NHL return after KHL exit; Bruins, Canucks & Avalanche linked to star
content: Evgeny Kuznetsov is eyeing a return to the NHL for the 2025-26 season. After a strong KHL stint, the veteran center is now one of the top unsigned free agents. We explore three potential NHL destinations, the Boston Bruins, Vancouver Canucks, and Colorado Avalanche. And that could benefit from his experience, skill, and potential resurgence.

title: No need to stay in Maha, UP or Raj, Mamata tells migrants
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has assured social security for migrant workers willing to return to the state, promising ration cards, health cards, and jobs. She directed officials to formulate a scheme for their return by train, emphasizing that Bengal will provide for its people. Banerjee also criticized the alleged persecution of Bengalis in other states and defended the skills of Bengali workers.

title: PM Modi can rewrite J&K’s history with dialogue: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Former J&K CM Mehbooba Mufti urged the Centre to abandon its security-centric approach and embrace dialogue, asserting PM Modi could resolve the Kashmir issue. She criticized the revocation of Article 370 for deepening alienation, not bringing peace. Defending PDP's alliance with BJP in 2015, she emphasized the party's commitment to dialogue and a peaceful J&K integrated with India through mutual respect.

title: TOI explains: How Nisar was built - why it’ll take 90 days before any data comes in
content: The Nasa-Isro Synthetic Aperture Radar (Nisar) satellite is scheduled to launch on July 30 aboard the GSLV-F16 rocket from Sriharikota. Following launch, a meticulous deployment sequence will unfold over several weeks, including the deployment of a massive 12-meter radar antenna. After a 90-day commissioning phase, Nisar will commence its science operations, capturing crucial data on Earth's surface changes using its L-band and S-band frequencies.

title: Statehood demand: Congress announces August 5 as Black day in J&K
content: The Congress party in J&K has announced it will observe August 5th as a 'Black Day' to mark six years since the abrogation of Article 370 and the downgrading of the state. JKPCC president Tariq Hameed Karra stated that peaceful sit-in protests will be held on August 5th, followed by hunger strikes from August 9th to 20th, excluding August 15th and 16th.

title: Op Sindoor debate: How can 'gora' in White House declare ceasefire? asks Owaisi
content: Asaduddin Owaisi criticized the government in Lok Sabha regarding Donald Trump's ceasefire announcement between India and Pakistan, questioning the implications for national pride and the armed forces. He also challenged the planned India-Pakistan cricket match following civilian deaths in Baisaran, citing the Prime Minister's stance against mixing blood and water.

title: 'JD Vance warned PM Modi of massive Pak attack' - Jaishankar in LS during Op Sindoor debate
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar informed the Lok Sabha about US Vice President JD Vance's alert to PM Modi regarding an imminent Pakistani attack on May 9, which was later foiled by Indian forces. India's retaliatory Operation Sindoor followed the Pahalgam terror attack, targeting terror infrastructure in Pakistan.

title: Boeing may be benefitting big from Donald Trump's trade war despite regulatory hurdles
content: Amidst recent setbacks, Boeing is poised to benefit from trade deals orchestrated by US President Donald Trump. These agreements are expected to generate new aircraft orders, potentially aiding Boeing's recovery. However, experts question the extent of Trump's influence, suggesting that many orders would have materialized regardless.

title: Only 3 of 190 nations which are part of UN opposed Op Sindoor, says Jaishankar - Top quotes
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar addressed the Lok Sabha regarding the government's response to the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. He highlighted India's zero-tolerance stance on terrorism. Jaishankar mentioned global support received post-attack. He criticized past governments' inaction after 26/11. The minister also spoke about India's strengthened regional ties and engagement with the UN Security Council.

title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ first official trailer out
content: Disney has released the first trailer for James Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash,' showcasing new tribes and escalating conflict on Pandora. Jake Sully's family unites with the Metkayina to battle Varang and her fire-wielding Ash People, allied with Quaritch. Cameron promises a longer, emotionally intense film, with the movie scheduled to release on December 19, 2025.

title: When Pakistan Test team left the ground leaving Gavaskar stranded at 86
content: An old controversy resurfaced as parallels are drawn to the Stokes-Jadeja incident. In the 1983 Bangalore Test, Pakistan's captain Zaheer Abbas controversially left the field, halting play for nearly half an hour and leaving Sunil Gavaskar stranded. Gavaskar, battling illness, eventually completed his century amidst the drama, with teammates and officials questioning Zaheer's sportsmanship.

title: Cambodia–Thailand ceasefire: Trump takes credit; declares himself 'prez of peace'
content: US President Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering a ceasefire between Cambodia and Thailand, following deadly clashes along their disputed border. The truce, officially declared in Kuala Lumpur under Malaysian mediation, aims to halt the fighting that displaced thousands. While sporadic clashes persisted, Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Manet thanked Trump for his support.

title: Operation Mahadev: 'Pahalgam attack mastermind' among 3 terrorists killed
content: In Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, security forces neutralized three terrorists in an intense firefight near Dachigam National Park. The operation, dubbed "Operation Mahadev," follows reports linking the terrorists to the April 22 Pahalgam attack, where numerous tourists and a local resident were killed.

title: Nevada shooting: Multiple people injured after gunfire at Reno Casino Resort
content: A shooting occurred at Grand Sierra Resort in Reno. The incident happened on Monday morning. Several people sustained injuries. Police responded to reports of an active shooter. An adult male suspect is now in custody. He was taken to a local hospital. The police exchanged gunfire with the suspect. Authorities say there is no ongoing threat.

title: IND vs ENG: Geoffrey Boycott takes a swipe at Ben Stokes - 'There is no way...'
content: Geoffrey Boycott has criticized Ben Stokes and the England team for perceived poor sportsmanship during the Manchester Test's final day. Boycott questioned Stokes' decision to offer a handshake, suggesting Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar deserved the chance to complete their centuries. He also highlighted England's bowling deficiencies, noting that Stokes himself was their best bowler in both innings.

title: Luka Doncic's stunning weight loss earns Men's Health Cover
content: Luka Doncic, traded by the Mavericks partly over fitness concerns, now sports a remarkable physique on Men's Health, signaling a new chapter with the Lakers. He dedicated his offseason to intense training and nutrition, aiming to reach his peak performance. Dallas traded Doncic for Cooper Flagg, a move that now faces scrutiny as Doncic's transformation and Lakers leadership loom large.

title: Asia Cup: India should not play cricket with Pakistan - Lok Sabha MP
content: Amidst ongoing tensions, Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Arvind Sawant has urged India to avoid playing cricket with Pakistan, particularly concerning the upcoming Asia Cup 2025. During a Lok Sabha debate, Sawant questioned the decision to halt war with Pakistan without reclaiming Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

title: IND vs ENG: Jadeja lacks ability to win Tests in overseas - Ex-India opener
content: Navjot Singh Sidhu has critiqued Ravindra Jadeja's overseas Test performance, despite his recent century in Manchester. Sidhu acknowledged Jadeja's restrictive bowling but questioned his match-winning ability, contrasting him with Kapil Dev. This criticism intensified after India's 22-run defeat at Lord's, where Jadeja's conservative approach was debated.

title: 'They trust others more than own ministers': Shah intervenes during EAM's speech to target oppn
content: During a Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, Union minister Amit Shah criticized the opposition for disrupting S Jaishankar's speech, alleging they trust foreign narratives more than Indian ministers. Jaishankar outlined India's firm response to the Pahalgam attack, including suspending the Indus Waters Treaty and reducing Pakistani High Commission staff.

title: 'At no stage in talks with US ... ': EAM shreds Trump’s 'trade' claim; explains ceasefire trigger
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar refuted Donald Trump's assertion that trade negotiations facilitated a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. Jaishankar clarified in Lok Sabha that no such linkage existed in discussions with the US. He also criticized the Congress party's past actions while highlighting the government's success in addressing terror sites and designating TRF as a global terrorist organization.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-India cricketer slams Gambhir's tactics – 'Take a chill pill'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar has criticized Gautam Gambhir's coaching during the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, citing "poor tactics" and "questionable selections." Manjrekar disputes Gambhir's claim that Karun Nair wasn't dropped, emphasizing India's past losses under Gambhir's leadership. He attributes the team's fighting spirit to the players, not tactical decisions.

title: Patrick Mahomes’s wife Brittany, reacts to grandma Randi’s photo album featuring grandkids
content: Randi Mahomes, Patrick Mahomes' mother, recently shared heartwarming photos from "Grandi Camp 2025" with her grandkids, Sterling and Bronze. Brittany Mahomes reacted with love to the pictures of Randi spending quality time with the children.

title: ‘Halt all terminations…’: TCS layoffs prompt NITES to write to labour minister; what it said
content: TCS layoffs NITES, an IT union, has appealed to the Union labour minister regarding TCS's plan to cut over 12,000 jobs, deeming the dismissals unlawful and demanding immediate reinstatement of affected employees. The union also highlighted concerns about delayed onboarding practices and the significant increase in CEO compensation amidst these layoffs, urging accountability from TCS's leadership.

title: Chess | What did Divya say after becoming first Indian to win WC? Full details
content: Divya Deshmukh, with modest expectations, remarkably won the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025, securing a spot in the Candidates tournament and the World Cup title. This victory automatically granted her the Grandmaster title, bypassing the usual norm and rating requirements. Deshmukh defeated Koneru Humpy, becoming the fourth Indian woman to achieve Grandmaster status.

title: IND vs ENG : Stokes hits back at Jadeja and Washington - 'Ten more runs...'
content: England captain Ben Stokes expressed frustration after Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar declined his offer for a draw, prioritizing personal milestones over team strategy. Stokes aimed to protect his bowlers from potential injuries with a quick turnaround before the final Test.

title: 'Proud of young Divya': PM Modi congratulates 19-yo on becoming first Indian to win WC title
content: Nineteen-year-old Divya Deshmukh made history by becoming the first Indian woman to win the FIDE Women's World Cup, defeating Koneru Humpy in a tiebreak. The crucial match saw Koneru make inaccurate moves, ultimately benefiting Divya, who capitalised on the opportunity. PM Modi and President Murmu congratulated Deshmukh on her remarkable achievement.

title: Khabib Nurmagomedov shuts door on UFC return with honest message about fight life
content: Khabib Nurmagomedov has clarified that he will not return to fighting. He says preparing for a fight requires at least six months of dedicated training. Khabib retired after defeating Justin Gaethje in 2020, fulfilling a promise to his mother. Now, he focuses on coaching Islam Makhachev and his cousins. He has dismissed any possibility of a comeback to UFC.

title: Stock market at near two-month lows: Why are FIIs selling Indian stocks? Explained
content: Indian stock markets are experiencing a downturn, hitting near two-month lows as Nifty50 and Sensex drop over 2%. Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) are aggressively selling, driven by factors like a strengthening US dollar, uncertainty around a US trade deal, and Q1 earnings.

title: ED gets five-day custodial remand of Chhangur Baba
content: When not covering crime, he reads fiction, roams around the dark alleys of the city in the dead of night. An MA (English Litt) from University of Lucknow, Pathikrit loves to speak French, well at least a smattering of it. He did his graduation in French language. A recipient of the Road Safety Fellowship of the United Nations, Pathikrit drives cautiously and advises others to do that too. title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
content: the 2025 draft has wrapped up, with the rookie class debuting at summer leagues and teams looking ahead to next season . we polled 20 anonymous executives and scouts, asking for their thoughts on the draft and what teams are expecting from their new faces .

title: Stakes too high at Spa to risk safety on wet-weather drama
content: the Belgium GP has been suspended after just one formation lap behind the safety car . rain fell over one of motor racing's most revered circuits midway through Sunday afternoon . the anthem was sung in heavy rain, although it seemed to be easing off by the time the scheduled 3 p.m. local start time approached .

title: Euro 2025 Talking Points: Best match, goal, player, Team of the Tournament
content: the Lionesses are back-to-back champions, but which players made a name for themselves on the biggest stage? Emily Keogh, Tom Hamilton, Beth Lindop, Julien Laurens and Sam Marsden have been on the ground in Switzerland this summer .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Gonzalez goes down for Pats
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: Tigers get pitcher Paddack in trade with Twins
content: the Detroit Tigers acquired starting pitcher Chris Paddack in a trade with the Minnesota Twins on Monday . the Tigers also received right-hander Randy Dobnak in the deal, with catching/first-base prospect Enrique Jimenez going to the Twins .
